title: Charles Thomas 2016 Red (Côtes du Rhône)
description: While quiet on the nose, this Grenache-based blend offers ripe black cherry and plum flavors, offset by bright acidity and a hint of savory earth and game. It's elegant but easy-drinking, with a moderately long finish.

title: Château Barbeiranne 2017 L'Ange Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This is a deliciously ripe wine, full of generous red-berry fruits with a soft texture. Juicy, fruity and lightly crisp at the end, it is an immediately drinkable, attractive wine.

title: Château de la Noblesse 2016 White (Bandol)
description: Clairette, Ugni Blanc and Rolle are a combination common to white Provence wines, giving an herbal character as well as crisp acidity and a creamy texture. The wine is ripe with touches of tropical fruits as well as green fruits in the background. Drink now.

title: Château des Coccinelles 2016 Syrah-Grenache (Côtes du Rhône)
description: Fleshy dried plum and cherry flavors are forward and fruity in this voluptuous red wine. Firm, slightly tacky tannins lend structure to the midpalate. Enjoy now rather than cellaring to enjoy its exuberant fruit.

title: Château d'Ollières 2017 Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)
description: This wine is all about fruit, crisp and light. Its easy texture, attractively balanced with juicy acidity, gives the wine a bright tangy character that is immediately attractive. Drink now.

title: Château d'Ollières 2017 White (Coteaux Varois en Provence)
description: A soft and ripe blend of Rolle and Ugni Blanc, this wine has a lightly salty character, with a touch of southern herbs as well as crisp green and apple fruit. This bright wine will be ready to drink from late 2018.

title: Château la Verrière 2017  Bordeaux Blanc
description: Spicy, rounded and with attractive acidity to match, this wine is rich and full in the mouth. Green-fruit flavors are balanced by the ripe apricot, nutmeg and vanilla richness. Drink now.

title: Château Mont-Redon 2016 Abielle-Fabre White (Côtes du Rhône)
description: Silken, mouth clinging texture is at the fore in this dry, full-bodied blend of equal parts Grenache Blanc, Viognier and Roussanne. The palate offers ripe but restrained pressed red apple and pear notes, accented by a hints of hazelnut and spice. Fresh acidity brightens the warming finish.

title: Château Sainte Roseline 2017 Le Cloître Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: The 13th-century cloisters that form the basis of this chateau have given their name to this entry-level cuvée. Despite its high alcohol, this offers classically crisp, intense fruity acidity rounded out by the red-currant and berry flavors. Drink now.

title: Chatham 2016 Church Creek Cabernet Franc (Virginia's Eastern Shore)
description: Brambly and stalky on the nose, this wine boasts tones of blackberry and black-currant leaf with a savory, meaty undertone. The palate is similar but offers more spicy notes. This is a Cabernet Franc with a lot of weight and body but the acidity holds up. The finish is long and savory.

title: Chloe 2015 San Lucas Cabernet Sauvignon (San Lucas)
description: Strong blackberry aromas meet with oregano and dried thyme, and those herbs take center stage on the nose after a while. On the palate, the dark fruit is the backbone, but the tobacco, black pepper and dried herbs take the spotlight.

title: Domaine de la Janasse 2017 Rosé (Vin de Pays de la Principauté d’Orange)
description: Delicately concentrated red currant and sour cherry notes are accented by bristling acidity and savory earth and bramble tones here. It's an elegant, dry rosé with more demure charm than buoyant, primary fruit. The finish is brisk yet thirst-quenching.
region_1: Vin de Pays de la Principauté d’Orange

title: Domaine de la Présidente 2016 Grands Classiques White (Côtes du Rhône)
description: Savory apple and pear flavors are dusted with crushed earth and salt notes in this dry, full-bodied white. It's a hefty, warming wine with lavish texture and soft, yielding acidity. The finish is edged by hints of salt and almond. Drink now.

title: Domaine Poli 2017 Niellucciu Rosé (Ile de Beauté)
description: Bright red fruit and a refreshingly light texture mark this intensely fruity wine. Lively acidity makes it ready to drink.

title: Early Mountain 2016 Petit Manseng (Virginia)
description: Concentrated aromas of orange rind, chamomile, red plum and mango follow through to the palate, with a hint of coconut. The body is full in feel and lends itself to a long and warm finish.

title: Fabre en Provence 2017 Château de la Clapière Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Owned by the Fabre family since 1928, this estate is close to the sea. This wine, with its smooth texture, red-currant fruit and peppery edge is ripe, full and ready to drink.

title: Fabre en Provence 2017 Château de l'Aumerade Cuvée Marie-Christine Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Bright and fruity, this is a light, crisp wine. Red-currant flavors are lit by the acidity and filled out with spice and a touch of pepper. Drink now.

title: Falchini 2014 Vigna a Solatio Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)
description: Aromas evoking pressed spring flowers and exotic fruit lead the nose of this wine. The lean, racy palate delivers pineapple, citrus, bitter almond and toast notes, alongside brisk acidity.

title: Girasole 2016 Hybrid Red (Mendocino County)
description: This is a straightforward medium-bodied dry wine based on Merlot that has plenty of cherry and berry aromas, nicely concentrated flavors and a touch of tannin to give some grip to the mouthfeel.

title: Greyscale 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Sticky tannins surround a muddled structure of big flavor in this otherwise mild-mannered wine, blended with small percentages of Merlot and Petit Verdot. Clove and oak overrule the fruit, which is black but somewhat elusive.

title: Grosso Kresser 2012 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Very concentrated aromas of kirsch make for a thick, slightly sweet-smelling entry to this bottling. The palate dries up considerably, showing rose petals, salted plums and dried red cherries.

title: Guicciardini Strozzi 2016 Villa Cusona  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)
description: This offers pretty yellow flower and beeswax aromas while the rounded palate doles out ripe apricot, mature yellow apple and orange zest flavors. A tangy mineral note suggesting oyster shells lifts the finish.

title: Hahn 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Very roasted aromas of hickory smoke and grilled black cherry show on the nose of this bottling. There is good smoke at the tip of the sip, then a more dense black-fruit character with hints of roasted coffee.

title: Heron Hill 2015 Reserve Merlot (Finger Lakes)
description: There's a mix of fresh- and stewed-fruit tones in this wine, with baked red currant and fresher cranberry notes. The palate is round and juicy in feel, with grainy tannins and a mild oak flavor.

title: Komodo Dragon 2014 Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is 49% Merlot, 30% Cabernet Sauvignon and 21% Syrah. The aromas offer notes of plum, herb and plentiful exotic spice, along with a whiff of tire rubber. The palate mixes lighter-styled blue- and black-fruit flavors that taper toward the finish.

title: Lakewood 2016 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)
description: Aromas of strawberry and cherry are covered in a sheen of vanilla cream on the nose. This red is light in feel, with soft tannins that offer some support to the juicy red fruit core on the palate.

title: Les Vignobles Gueissard 2017 Cuvée G White (Côtes de Provence)
description: Light, bright and fruity, this is already an attractive wine. Dominated by Vermentino, it has a young, herbal character that will soften, although it is refreshing and crisp now. Let this bright, fruity wine wait until late 2018 before drinking.

title: Litore 2016 Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Citrus aromas are forceful and show a hint of green bell pepper. A plump melony palate is healthy and easygoing. Briny green-melon flavors are modest on a finish that indicates that it's time to drink this.

title: Malenchini 2016  Chianti Colli Fiorentini
description: This opens with subdued aromas suggesting dark fruit and baking spices. The simple, lively palate delivers raspberry jam and white pepper flavors, with a sprinkling of clove and rounded tannins. Drink soon.

title: Marqués de Cáceres 2016 Deusa Nai Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Oily citrus aromas are offset by dusty scents and yeasty notes. A citrusy palate has pulpy weight and acidic tang. Briny, slightly pickled flavors of cucumber and citrus fruits finish salty, with a note of lime. Drink now.
